result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton J. Clairmore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof.

Absolute sobriety.  

Contact with any victims only as approved by PO.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

Safe Program intake/assessment and follow up on any recommendations.

AODA and any follow up.

Probation Review Hearing 8/17/2018 at 1:15pm.

timeConds.notes: with the last 60 days I/S to be used for rule violations, with huber for work/treatment if deft qualifies under jail classification system.
I/S to be used for rule violations.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  T.B.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings (Rothschild PD).  3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
